page.title: 10Arable at Pitlock Farm
page.content: Pitlock Farm was a fruit farm four years ago. The owners decided that too many farms were becoming fruit farms. An interesting factor about Pitlock is that it has a pond which Worcester {Conservationists}are interested in; there is plenty of wildlife. Mallard duck were tried out, but the foxes ate them. The actual farm is 60 acres. The main land use is arable: it has equal amounts of winter wheat, barley and herbage seed. They have some forage seed which they sell to merchants for cattle feed and combine seed. They have 3 farms nearby, adding up to 400 acres in all. The actual {farmhouse}dates from the 14-15th century; it has an impressive chimney. The roof used to be thatched.
